name: skysail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a sail that is usually the top sail on a mast (= a tall pole) on a sailing boat: A skysail is the uppermost sail in many old square-rigged ships, though sometimes topped by a moonraker.
More examplesFewer examplesMost ship owners considered skysails more ornamental than useful.The Portsmouth-built Noonday had only one skysail, on her mainmast.Few ships carried skysails in the 1920s.
